data.title: Best Ever Matzo Ball Soup
data.text:
Dined here last Saturday with hopes of getting something fairly light and quick. Opted for matzo ball soup and an everything bagel toasted with cream cheese.  Let me say that upon first appearance I knew that the soup was home made with large chunks of juicy chicken, carrots, celery, and a huge matzo ball that was absolutely delicious, fluffy and light. Each spoonful got better and better as time went on. I have always been a lover of good, fresh, home made soups, and this one definitely goes to the top of my list.

Service was above average and the only downside was that they did not have any bacon scallion cream cheese for my bagel, but that was no big deal. With winter coming up in a few months I will return for the matzo ball soup on the very first bitterly cold day, but I will order a bowl rather than a cup for sure!

data.title: Ok Food. Grumpy Staff
data.text: It was not busy when we went for breakfast but the biggest thing that struck me was how unfriendly the staff were. Our waitress was ok . She did her job nicely but nothing outstanding. The food was average but nothing to return for.Everything would have been better with a warm greeting and a thank you for coming when leaving.

data.title: Decent Deli for Lunch...
data.text: Stopped here after go I ng to the nearby courthouse and enjoyed a very good reuben.  Nice pickle bowl accompianing meals here.  Service is fast and efficient.  Good stop if you are in the neighborhood.   Parking is free with your meal.

data.title: Decent place to grab a bite
data.text:
I came in here during late lunch and I was really impressed with the quality of the food and the speed the food came out.

I ordered a California Chicken sandwich and it was a big delicious beast. The fries that came with the sandwich were better than average. I ate half my sandwich and most of the fries and brought the rest back to my mother who devoured it and noted the fries were even delicious cold.

I thought the prices were about 20% inflated, which is why I only left 4 stars, but the quality and size of my meal are an argument for the higher than average prices.

The server was nice and quick as well.

data.title: The Pickle Palace
data.text: That's what a friend and I use as shorthand to name Woodside when setting lunch meetings. We've had burgers, omelets and sandwiches (along with pickles from the barrels) and have never been disappointed.  Basic food, yes, but solid, authentic and tasty. And the service is always cheery and quick. It's easy to understand why many people make Woodside a regular stop.

data.title: Great Family Deli where you can be a Regular
data.text: I eat breakfast here nearly every Sunday.  They have an extensive menu and will pretty much customize anything that you want.  The wait staff are great.  I really like how they are pleasant and kind to their older customers, many of whom have been going there for years.  It's like going home again.  And the food is pretty good too!

data.title: Great for breakfast and lunch
data.text: I love Woodside. The food is always great and the atmosphere is fun and upbeat.  The servers get a little slow at lunch when it's busy so make sure you get your check early if you need to scoot out quick.

data.title: A Real Deli
data.text: Everyone in our family loves the Woodside Deli!  The food here is quintessential deli food, with everything from hash and eggs to meatloaf and mashed potatoes to liver and onions. Breakfast is served any time of day.  Barrels of pickles and slaws greet diners at the door, free for the taking once you are seated.  The food is always good, service is friendly and timely.  The atmosphere is wonderful - walls are jam-packed with vintage photographs and ads which makes waiting for your food go quickly.   All in all, this is a family favorite, especially for a weekend breakfast.  We would all highly recommend it!

data.title: Great food!
data.text: For whatever reason, the Rockville location is never as crowded as the old location near Congressional Plaza or the one in Silver Spring. This is a great place for breakfast or lunch and the staff is very nice and very efficient. Love going here and they serve grits!

data.title: After Countless Positive Experiences, This Time Was Awful
data.text: With no real dinner planned at 6:30pm, we decided to visit our local favorite deli. As much as I am not a creature of habit, I often order one of two things here regardless of the time of day: blintzes or stuffed cabbage (an acquired taste, I know). On this particular night, I ordered the stuffed cabbage and requested extra sauce. My meal arrived without sauce of much, let alone extra sauce. The leaves looked dried out. I returned the meal, not willing to try it again. I requested an open-faced hot tuna melt sandwich. The kaiser roll arrived barely toasted and a scoop of tuna that was cold. I was done. They gave me the sandwich at no charge. We left. I grilled the sandwich when I got home, heating all the ingredients, including the barely-melted cheese to perfection. it's a good thing the meal was free since I ended up cooking. This place is usually good - never great. The staff is hit and miss, with most being good. On this particular night, the waitress was expecting a fight, often found with people from this area. Although I didn't fight or create a stink of any kind, I certainly could have. But, what would that have done, really? I'm saddened that one of my favorite go-to places left me with such a bad taste in my mouth - literally. I will probably try it again sometime, but not in the near future.

data.title: Pickle Bar, Unusual
data.text: Lunch and service was very satisfactory. The restaurant has a pickle bar, something I never seen. That why I found this deli better than average.

data.title: Nicely done.
data.text: Love the free pickles of all sorts. The waitress did a good job, albeit a bit slow, but the place was crowded. The hot dog was large and nicely prepared with large fresh onion rights. The chile and french onion soup were good. The tuna salad plate had a big scoop of tuna, potato salad, and coleslaw with tomato and onion on the side.

data.title: Breakfast of Champions
data.text: Following a weekend in D.C. with adult kids, we continued our holiday journey towards Gettysburg and stopped in Rockville for a late breakfast. The Woodside Deli was a delightful find! We had complete, full-service breakfasts with a few extras including perhaps the best corned beef hash ever and the hot chocolate was amazingly decadent. The staff was charming, very attentive and full of holiday spirit!

data.title: Delicious diner type food
data.text: The food is delicious and the menu is extensive.  They have classic diner dishes - meatloaf, pancakes, matzoh ball soup, but also other offerings - subs, falafel, lasagna. I'm happy to report that this place offers scrapple!  They also serve breakfast all day, which I particularly like when I'm eating a this type of restaurant.  They make their own pickles which are in barrels, for you to help yourself.  All in all, tasty food in a comfortable atmosphere.  The service is very good and fast.

data.title: Good deli
data.text: I liked the Reuben sandwich here. Very authentic, such as they serve in New York. Try this place if you are craving some old-fashioned comfort food.

data.title: Awesome
data.text: I have searched for a good place for a good breakfast sandwich since I've moved here. The breakfast sandwich I got here was amazing. It made me feel that I was back in NY! So awesome.

data.title: Authentic NY Style Deli
data.text: Authentic Jewish style deli offering an extensive menu for breakfast or lunch.  Don't miss out on the free pickle bar!  Pancakes and omelettes are great breakfast offerings and available all day.   Enjoy a New York style reuben or corned beef sandwich.  Excellent salads.  Portions are large, prices are reasonable, and the service is very good.  I frequent the Silver Spring Woodside Deli as well as this location in Rockville.  Both are terrific!  Great location for any time of the day.  Well worth the visit.

data.title: turkey club is amazing
data.text: who doesn't love a pickle bar!? The food is always good and the servers are so nice! It also helps that they validate your parking. a great place to see movers and shakers in Montgomery County.

data.title: A gem
data.text:
The Woodside Deli has been around for a long time and is a neighborhood fixture in the Rockville downtown area from what I understand, yet I discovered it only recently after trying out a Groupon. I now realize I had been seriously missing out. It is easy to miss this seemingly small restaurant as it's nestled in a very unassuming strip mall away from the bustle of the newly built downtown attractions. But inside, it's comfortable and nicely renovated with a lot of seating and some warm, colorful touches in the simple but attractive decor. The service is impeccable and quick, at least on both weekday evenings we went (once with the groupon, then the second time without). The best thing to bet on, however, is the food. The portions are large as is typical with delis and diners, but the Woodside Reuben, Charbroiled Chicken sandwich, and the Woodside Skillet we ordered on the two visits were each impeccable. The Skillet is on the breakfast menu, served all day, and a flavorful medley of eggs, fresh diced potatoes, peppers, onions and sausage which can be replaced with turkey sausage on request. Replacements were happily accommodated (we had several!). A strawberry milkshake ordered for our toddler was served in an enormous served freshly hand spun, complete with extra ice cream on the side. The Reuben was the highlight--the ingredients were all basic, but the beef was deliciously seasoned and the rye fresh and hot. Couldn't be better. The seasoning in the charbroiled chicken was also just right. The fries are crisp and batter-fried, served piping hot and delicious--the servings are very liberal and the three of us were easily able to share one order of fries.

A very nice touch is the complimentary pickle bar, which you don't usually find. About half a dozen varieties of pickles and pickled salads were for the taking, and added great flavor to our meals each time. 

Definitely a five star rating for a place that has maintained its edge in a neighborhood that has no dearth of eateries...and done it the old-fashioned way: no bells and whistles, just awesome food.

data.title: okay for breakfast
data.text:
Rockville is unfortunately known for its dearth of breakfast and brunch restaurants.  We had not had a lot of luck before with Woodside deli, but we had a coupon and decided to give it another whirl.  We went around 9 on a Saturday morning and were a littel concerned that the restaurant was pretty empty.  Since we had complained before about lousy service, this quiet worked to our advantage.

We seated ourselves in a nice booth.  Hubby ordered coffee and when I inquired about types of hot tea, I was told on the the plain stuff was available, but that  they did have a chai latte.  I had never had one before, but in a word, it was yummy.  Frothy and spicy with some cinnamin sprinkled on top, it might become my new favorite morning drink.

The entire menu is identical to the other two restaurants named Woodside Deli (Silver Spring and Germantown) but it is important to note that there is no relationship between the 3 restaurants, just the menus purchased from the original (Silver Spring) location.

Hubby ordered his favorite - a breakfast burrito and I had a Belgian waffle with a scoop of chocolate ice cream and a side of bacon.  The waitress automatically brought butter and syrup (which I did not need) before my waffle arrived as well as extra napkins which came in handy. Once she saw the waffle and ice cream together the waitress thought it might be good with some whipped cream which she brought in a separate dish.

The burrito was pretty close to the same as at the other restaurants but a little spicier.  The waffle was nice and crispy as was the bacon.  The ice cream had crystals in it, so probably could have been handled more carefully.  Coffee refills came often, but the extra salsa my hubby asked for was never delivered.

Parking here is pretty nasty.  You must enter through a gate located to the side of the strip stores, and then either pay, or validate (2 hours free) your ticket inside.  Lost tickets are charged the maximum rate payable by credit card on the way out of the lot.  You can only make a right turn from the parking lot, which leads you away from downtown Rockvillle, so you have to circle around to get just about anywhere else

I am not sure I would come back on a busy night if for no other reason than the difficulty parking, but the food was okay and reasonably priced.  Service was considerably improved over our last visit.
